content: Well, I'm sorry for you that you won't be able to live in the Constitution-trampling Bush-Cheney police state, but you'll cope somehow. I heard all the same crap against President Clinton from all the right-wing-nuts. And you know what? The country survived. Fortunately, we also survived President Cheney Bush II. I know we're not going to come to a consensus today. All I can say is, wait 30-40 years, and see which Presidents still look good in hindsight. By the way, I don't consider myself a Democrat, and haven't since I voted for Reagan. But this anti-Obama sentiment that I keep seeing, both in print and in person, really bothers me. When I see it in person, I usually get a good dose of racism with it. Makes me wonder about what I see in print.

content: Well, I'm sorry for you that you won't be able to live in the Constitution-trampling Bush-Cheney police state, but you'll cope somehow. I heard all the same crap against President Clinton from all the right-wing-nuts. And you know what? The country survived. Fortunately, we also survived President Cheney Bush II. I know we're not going to come to a consensus today. All I can say is, wait 30-40 years, and see which Presidents still look good in hindsight. By the way, I don't consider myself a Democrat, and haven't since I voted for Reagan. But this anti-Obama sentiment that I keep seeing, both in print and in person, really bothers me. When I see it in person, I usually get a good dose of racism with it. Makes me wonder about what I see in print.

There is no reason to phrase a topic like this other that spread negativity. Instead of attacking others, simply point out the accomplishments of the President. I don't know what options there are to stop-loss other than bringing back the draft. And the insurance issue was definitly a misstep by the President. Still, I'm glad he changed course on that. Still, this is one money saving idea that never should have seen the light of day.

content: Well, I'm sorry for you that you won't be able to live in the Constitution-trampling Bush-Cheney police state, but you'll cope somehow. I heard all the same crap against President Clinton from all the right-wing-nuts. And you know what? The country survived. Fortunately, we also survived President Cheney Bush II. I know we're not going to come to a consensus today. All I can say is, wait 30-40 years, and see which Presidents still look good in hindsight. By the way, I don't consider myself a Democrat, and haven't since I voted for Reagan. But this anti-Obama sentiment that I keep seeing, both in print and in person, really bothers me. When I see it in person, I usually get a good dose of racism with it. Makes me wonder about what I see in print.
reply: Well, I'm sorry for you that you won't be able to live in the Constitution-trampling Bush-Cheney police state, but you'll cope somehow.
